identificationModule.briefTitle: Modified Pivotal Response Treatment for Insistence on Sameness in Autistic Youth
identificationModule.officialTitle: Modified Pivotal Response Treatment for Insistence on Sameness in Autistic Youth

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Professor of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this open label trial is to examine the preliminary effectiveness of a 12-week behavioral intervention program (1 hour/week) to treat insistence on sameness (e.g., difficulty tolerating changes in routine) in youth with autism spectrum disorder (ASD). Treatment will be delivered via secure telemedicine platform and consist of a combination of parent-training and child-focused intervention.

armGroups.label: Remote (Telehealth) Intervention Program
interventionNames: Behavioral: Modified Pivotal Response Treatment for Insistence on Sameness in Autistic Youth

interventions.name: Modified Pivotal Response Treatment for Insistence on Sameness in Autistic Youth
interventions.description: This is a 12-week intervention program (1 hour/week) of treatment to target insistence on sameness in youth with autism spectrum disorder (ASD). Treatment will be delivered via secure telemedicine platform and consist of combination of parent-training and child-focused intervention.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Insistence on Sameness Subscale of the Dimensional Assessment of Restricted and Repetitive Behaviors (DARB).
primaryOutcomes.description: DARB insistence on sameness subscale scores measure insistence on sameness with higher scores indicating greater intensity of insistence on sameness. \[Score Range: 0-76\]
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Screening, Baseline (full measure), 3 weeks (IS subscale), 6 weeks (IS subscale), 9 weeks (IS subscale), 12 weeks (full measure)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline on Blinded Clinician Ratings of Clinical Global Impression Scale, Severity and Improvement Ratings.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Score Range: 1 = normal, not at all ill; 7 = among the most extremely ill patients; 1 = very much informed since the initiation of treatment; 7 = very much worse since the initiation of treatment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Parent-Rated Emotion Dysregulation on the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire Dysregulation Profile (SDQ-DP) during treatment.
secondaryOutcomes.description: SDQ-DP indexes broad emotion dysregulation with higher scores indicating greater intensity of emotion dysregulation. \[Score Range: 1-27\]

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Parent-Rated Irritability as captured by the Aberrant Behavior Checklist (ABC), Irritability Subscale.
secondaryOutcomes.description: The ABC-I includes 15 items with higher scores indicating greater irritability. \[Score range: 0-45\].

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Ritualistic/Sameness Subscale of Repetitive Behavior Scale-Revised (RBS-R).
secondaryOutcomes.description: Higher scores indicate higher levels of RRBs. \[43 items, 12 in sameness domain\]

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Parent-Rated Challenging Behaviors on the Open-Source Challenging Behaviors Scale (OS-CBS).
secondaryOutcomes.description: The OS-CBS captures the severity of categories of challenging behaviors, including property destruction, aggression, elopement, conduct problems, and self-injurious behaviors, with the option to calculate a total score for each subscale and total challenging behavior, with higher score averages indicating higher severity. \[18 items\]

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Parent-Rated Anxiety as captured by the Anxiety Scale for Children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASC-ASD).
secondaryOutcomes.description: ASC-ASD captures anxiety with higher scores indicating greater anxiety severity across the subdomains of separation anxiety, uncertainty, performance anxiety, and anxious arousal. \[Score Range: 0-72\]

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Caregiver Self-Report on the Caregiver Strain Questionnaire Short Form (CGSQ-SF7).
secondaryOutcomes.description: The CGSQ-SF7 assesses additional demands, pressures, and responsibilities in families with youths suffering from behavioral or emotional disorders, with higher scores indicating greater strain. \[Score Range: 2-10\]

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in Caregiver Self-Report on the Warwick-Edinburg Mental Wellbeing Scales (WEMWS).
secondaryOutcomes.description: Higher scores indicate lower mental wellbeing. \[Score Range: 14-70\]

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in the Caregiver Self-Report Depression, Anxiety, and Stress Scale (DASS21).
secondaryOutcomes.description: Scores for depression, anxiety, and stress are calculated by summing the scores for the relevant items. \[Scores \> 34 fall in "extremely severe range'\]

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Caregiver Report Autism Symptoms Dimension Questionnaire (ASDQ).
secondaryOutcomes.description: Higher scores indicate greater levels of core autism characteristics. \[Score Range: 0-39\]

The EFS characterizes sequencing/working memory, response inhibition, set shifting, emotion regulation, and risk-taking facets of executive functioning. Higher scores indicate better executive functioning. \[Score Range: 0-52\]
Higher scores indicate better ability on the DLSS. \[Score Range: 0-53\]
